sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> causes the <radical>capital</radical> to become very <kanji>cool</kanji>. The capital was already a pretty cool temperature, but with the addition of the water from the tsunami, the capital is now very cool.
meaningInfo: Imagine being in the capital. The tsunami hits and now you are all wet. You are also very cool because the water is not warm. You are cool and wet. How sad.
readingMnemonic: You don’t like how <kanji>cool</kanji> it is in the capital now so you decide to get in your <reading>row</reading> (<ja>りょう</ja>) boat and row away to some place that is not so cool. Get in your row boat and row away!
readingInfo: Imagine rowing in your row boat. The more you row, the less cool it gets. Feel your arms strain as you do so. It’s all worth it!
